title: What are the music copyright laws for educational purposes? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: That's better phrased as “academic use”, associated with a class or research project at an accedited learning institution. That helps you understand the difference between the allowed uses compared to, say, a BBC animal documentary which is also “educational purpose, but not fair use. Use of a section of music as part of an assignment or research project is allowed. Other use, especially distribution to others, is copyright infringement. Consider: text books have to pay for the photos they use, pay their writers, buy the maps and graphics they use. They can't make a fair use claim, because their purpose is “educational”, but also to sell books commercially.
